overview:
## Return Value

An object that XPC can encode.

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCCoder/decodeXPCObject(ofType:forKey:)] method validates that the type of the decoded object matches the type of the encoded object. If they don’t match, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCCoder] throws an exception in support of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSecureCoding].

Be sure to check the result against [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNull/null] if you call an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/XPC] function because calling an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/XPC] function on a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNull/null] object results in a crash.

# decodeXPCObject(ofType:forKey:)

**Instance Method**

Decodes an object and validates that its type matches the type a service provides over XPC.

## Declaration

```swift
func decodeXPCObject(ofType type: xpc_type_t, forKey key: String) -> xpc_object_t?
```

## Parameters

- **type**: An opaque pointer to an encoded XPC object.
- **key**: A string that your app uses to reference the decoded object.

## Return Value

An object that XPC can encode.

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCCoder/decodeXPCObject(ofType:forKey:)] method validates that the type of the decoded object matches the type of the encoded object. If they don’t match, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSXPCCoder] throws an exception in support of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSecureCoding].

Be sure to check the result against [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNull/null] if you call an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/XPC] function because calling an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/XPC] function on a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNull/null] object results in a crash.

## Encoding and Decoding

- **encodeXPCObject(_:forKey:)**: Encodes an object to send over an XPC connection.
